description: This table contains a history of all reconcilable changes made to orders in a treatment day, as well as how the user reconciled those changes.  For example, if a medication order was discontinued, the discontinuation would appear in this table, as well as any actions taken on that modification (such as acknowledging it, or removing the order from future days).

columns.name: EVENT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the event record.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

columns.name: TX_REC_OTP_ID
columns.description: This item contains the ID of the order template that this action refers to.

columns.name: TX_REC_ORD_ID
columns.description: This item contains the ID of the order that this action refers to.

columns.name: TX_REC_EVENT_LINE
columns.description: This item contains the line number of the event where this action occurred.  This corresponds to the LINE column in the table ED_IEV_EVENT_INFO.

columns.name: TX_REC_CHANGE_TYP_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item contains the type of change documented on this line.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Review


Propagate


New Order


Dose Change


Discontinue


Build Change

columns.name: TX_REC_RVW_BY_LINE
columns.description: This item contains the line number of the action that reviewed this action.

columns.name: TX_REC_REVIEW_CMT
columns.description: For review actions, this item contains the comment entered by the user during the review process.

columns.name: TX_REC_OLD_ERX_ID
columns.description: For treatment plan reconciliation events, will hold the old medication (ERX) ID if this event came from a medication replacement.

columns.name: TX_REC_NEW_ERX_ID
columns.description: For treatment plan reconciliation events, will hold the new medication (ERX) ID if this even came from a medication replacement

columns.name: TX_REC_MESSAGE
columns.description: For treatment plan reconciliation events, will hold the reconciliation message
